intro: Curculigo breviscapa, commonly known as the short-horned arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its compact, rhizomatous growth habit and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged in a rosette pattern. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas.
